name: collections::btree::node::Handle::<collections::btree::node::NodeRef<collections::btree::node::marker::Mut<'a>, K, V, NodeType>, collections::btree::node::marker::KV>::split_leaf_data

collections::btree::node::NodeRef::<Borr.doc:
Finds the length of the node. This is the number of keys or values.
 The number of edges is `len() + 1`.
 Note that, despite being safe, calling this function can have the side effect
 of invalidating mutable references that unsafe code has created.

core::panicking::panic.doc: The underlying implementation of core's `panic!` macro when no formatting is used.

collections::btree::node::NodeRef::<coll.doc:
Borrows exclusive access to an element of the key storage area.

 # Safety
 `index` is in bounds of 0..CAPACITY

Borrows exclusive access to an element or slice of the node's value storage area.

 # Safety
 `index` is in bounds of 0..CAPACITY

core::ops::IndexMut::index_mut.doc:
Performs the mutable indexing (`container[index]`) operation.

 # Panics

 May panic if the index is out of bounds.

collections::btree::node::move_to_slice.doc:
Moves all values from a slice of initialized elements to a slice
 of uninitialized elements, leaving behind `src` as all uninitialized.
 Works like `dst.copy_from_slice(src)` but does not require `T` to be `Copy`.

collections::btree::node::NodeRef::<coll.doc: Borrows exclusive access to the length of the node.

doc:
Helps implementations of `split` for a particular `NodeType`,
 by taking care of leaf data.
